text: {| class="infobox" style="width: 25em; font-size: 95%;" |+ style="font-size: larger;" | AFL NEB Female Football League |- ! style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" bgcolor="White" div style="color:Pink"| General Information |- style="vertical-align: top;" | Founded | 2015 as AFL North East Border Youth GirlsGirls Footy Takes Flight! |- | Sports | Women's Football (2015–Present) |- | Affiliation | AFL Victoria Country (2015–Present) |- ! style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" bgcolor="White" div style="color:Pink"| Known As |- style="vertical-align: top;" | 2015-2017 | AFL NEB Youth Girls |- | 2018–present | AFL NEB Female Football League |- ! style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" bgcolor="White" div style="color:Pink"|2019 Compertitions |- style="vertical-align: top;" | Football | Women's Open Youth Girls (13's to 16's) |- |} The Australian Football League North East Border Female Football League (AFL NEB FFL) is a Women's Australian rules football competition based in the greater North East Victoria region of Victoria, Australia. ==History== The league was established in 2015 as a pathway for young girls who wanted to continue playing football after Auskick but were unable to compete in traditional male leagues across the region.Establishment Since its inception the league has grown to seven clubs and two competitions, one for women aged 13 to 16, and a second open-age competition for women aged 17 years and over. ==Clubs== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%; text-align:left;font-size:75%;" ! width="150px"|Club ! width="15px"|Colors ! width="100px"|Moniker ! width="100px"|Location ! width="15px"|State ! width="150px"|Ground ! width="50px"| ! width="50px"| Joined ! width="100px" | Premierships: Women's Open ! width="100px" | Premierships: Youth Girls |- ! | The Alpine Lions Female Football Club is supported by the Whorouly Football Netball Club.
